content.description: Blocky climb farthest from the road.  Start between the face and the short spire separate from the rock.
content.protection: Top rope.  Bring webbing for slinging trees at the top.

content.description: Start under the overhang and continue to top. Start to the right of the overhang for an easier variation.
content.protection: Top rope.  Bring webbing for slinging trees

content.description: This is the crack created by the large boulder falling out.  The crux is 30' up.  Toe holds get limited.  They reappear after about 10'.  Do not leave the crack until you mantle at the top.
content.protection: You'll need to set up a Top-rope with the LARGE tree to the left, looking from the bottom, and the small tree to the right as a backup.  100' of static from the large tree.  Webbing or other static from the small tree to position anchor directly over crack.
content.location: It's across the street from the parking lot, right behind the boulder that has fallen down.  Top rope is set-up by walking through the tunnel and up the steps.

content.description: Across the street from the parking lot.  Shaded and next to the water. Several route possibilities here of varying difficulty. Just set up a top rope an climb.
